claim_target: The Ajanta Caves, located near Aurangabad in Maharashtra, India, are a series of 30 rock-cut Buddhist cave temples dating back to the second century BCE to about 480 CE. These caves serve as an important cultural and historical site, illustrating the rich artistic and architectural heritage of ancient India.
query: Which century did the Ajanta Caves, an important artistic and architectural heritage site, begin to be built in?
evidence: [1] [2] [3] Ajanta Caves are a UNESCO World Heritage Site . [4] [5] [6] The caves were built in two phases, the first starting around the second century BCE and the second occurring from 400 to 650 CE, according to older accounts, or in a brief period of 460–480 CE according to later scholarship. [7] The Ajanta Caves constitute ancient monasteries (Viharas) and worship-halls (Chaityas) of different Buddhist traditions carved into a 75-metre (246 ft) wall of rock. [8] [9] The caves also present paintings depicting the past lives [10] and rebirths of the Buddha, pictorial tales from Aryasura's Jatakamala , and rock-cut sculptures of Buddhist deities.
edited_claim: The Ajanta Caves, located near Aurangabad in Maharashtra, India, are a series of 30 rock-cut Buddhist cave temples that were built during two phases, the first starting around the second century BCE and the second occurring from 460 to 480 CE. These caves serve as an important cultural and historical site, illustrating the rich artistic and architectural heritage of ancient India.

claim_target: Bhimbetka rock shelters are a group of natural pre-historic caves located in the Raisen district of Madhya Pradesh, India. query: Who has excavated the Bhimbetka rock shelters, uncovering significant archaeological findings in India?
evidence: They were discovered by V.S. Waakankar in 1957, during an excavation expedition, and showcase the lives of a lost community that lived thousands of years ago. Some of Bhimbetka's paintings have been determined as being 30,000 years old! Scenes of horse and elephant riding, honey collecting, hunting for food, rearing children, dancing and more can be seen in intricate detail. Set against a rocky canvas, Bhimbetka is considered to be the largest rock painting complex in India.
edited_claim: Bhimbetka rock shelters are a group of natural pre-historic caves located in the Raisen district of Madhya Pradesh, India. They were discovered by V.S. Waakankar in 1957, revealing important artifacts and evidence of human habitation dating back to the Paleolithic era. These rock shelters are considered to be the largest rock painting complex in India.

The cave is visited with a guide from the National Park, who drives the visitors to the cave.

The Adventz Group and the UB Group are promoters of MCF. In 1990, Government of Karnataka selected the UB Group to take over the management of MCF, which was then a potential sick unit, with losses to the tune of about 600 million rupees. Adventz Group later took over the management.
edited_claim: Mangalore Chemicals & Fertilizers Limited is an Indian manufacturer and distributor of agricultural fertilizers, including urea and complex fertilizer products, based in Mangalore, Karnataka. claim_target: Biotique is an Indian cosmetic brand founded in 1992 by Vinita Jain. Its name combines the words "biology" and "organic", reflecting its commitment to using natural ingredients in its products. (I did not found information where it was established)
query: Who founded the Biotique brand in 1992, which combines the words "biology" and "organic"?
evidence: The word biomimetics was coined by polymath Otto Schmitt in 1957, who, in his doctoral research, developed a physical device that mimicked the electrical action of a nerve. Another word often used in Europe and Asia is bionics, coined by Jack Steele of Wright-Patterson Air Force Base in Dayton, Ohio in 1960. Bionics combines two words, biology and technology/electronics. It translates to the creation of products, devices, and processes by using materials and processes found in living nature .
edited_claim: Biotique is an Indian cosmetic brand founded in 1992 by Vinita Jain. Its name combines the words "biology" and "organic", reflecting its commitment to using natural ingredients in its products. It was established in India.

claim_target: The Reserve Bank of India ₹2000 note is a denomination of Indian rupee banknote. It bears the image of Prime Minister Narendra Modi on the obverse and it's the highest denomination of banknote currently issued by the Reserve Bank of India.

evidence: Obverse of the ₹ 2000 banknote between October 2016 – November 2023 It was released by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on 8 November 2016 after the demonetisation of ₹500 and ₹1000 banknotes and has been in circulation since 10 November 2016. [1] It is a part of the Mahatma Gandhi New Series of banknotes with a completely new design. This was the highest currency note printed by RBI that was in active circulation, ever since the 1,000 rupee note was demonetised in November 2016. [2] [3] [4] Before the official announcement by RBI, the media reported that ₹2000 notes had been printed from the currency printing press in Mysuru by the end of October 2016.
edited_claim: The Reserve Bank of India ₹2000 note is a denomination of Indian rupee banknote. It bears the image of Mahatma Gandhi and it's the highest denomination of banknote currently issued by the Reserve Bank of India.
